diagnosis.final_diagnosis: acute cholecystitis, delirium, pancreatic dilatation secondary to stricture
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with abdominal discomfort and dark-colored loose stools, with vital signs indicating elevated white blood cells and liver function tests, along with imaging findings of pericholecystic hyperemia and gallbladder wall edema without gallstones, supporting the diagnosis of acute cholecystitis.
